title: Nice app
comment: If only it can run adrift file, I'll give 6 star.

title: Best interpreter on android
comment: It is the only interpreter which works with .gam files. The best there is when it comes to interactive fiction.

title: More customization would be nice...
comment: ... But it does the job well, otherwise.

title: Love it for Classics...
comment: But will we ever see glulxe / gblorb interpretation for all the Inform7 titles out there?

title: Best IF interpreter on Android
comment: By miles. All others seem to have bugs, or are awkward to use, have input or scrolling issues. This one works perfectly!
Love this app

title: Good, but...
comment: Loses a star for the fact that Theatre won't open in this app on my device because of an unreasonable screen size restriction (am now playing it in the Text Fiction app). Otherwise, just like Hunky Punk except without the dodgy permissions. EDIT: Okay, so by using a workaround I figured out that my issue was with the file, not this app. On that basis, I'm restoring your fourth star.

title: The best android IF interpreter I have used
comment: This is still a work in progress, but is the best interpreter for Android I have seen, and the only one I know of that supports TADS. HTML tads and/or graphics support and more formats will see 5 stars from me, as then it will be all I need for IF on my phone/tablet.

title: good
comment: Can you add gblorb suport?

title: Images
comment: Great app, would be great if images were supported! Love the implementation though, and works relatively well.

title: Can't read some books
comment: I'm playing Anchorhead and there are some books that won't display (the Frazer history, for example). I'm also running into a memory leak when the transcript reaches a certain size where the keyboard will start to severely lag. Restarting the game with a clear log fixes that. Any helps with the readable issue would be appreciated.

title: Great app but...
comment: I've been playing Infocom's Border Zone with this app but it gets stuck with the status line when watching the searchlights in the Border chapter to be able to get to the fence and proceed further. Could you please fix this? Otherwise best IF interpreter out there.

title: Great app
comment: Has some good features and supports both z machine and TADS formats, has run everything I've thrown at it so far. Main improvement I'd make is to add options to change text and background colour, at the moment its not easy on the eyes but still, if you like interactive fiction you should get this.

title: Just one little thing
comment: Incredibly good app. Just fix the TADS error in The Plant and the resolution requirements for Theatre and I will rate 5 stars :D

title: Great interpteter
comment: Very full-featured for a mobile app.

title: Looks good so far, but...
comment: I currently can't use this yet, without a dark theme. Hopefully you'll add that choice in a future version.

title: Best z-machine interp, but could use some improvements...
comment: This is by far one of the best z-machine interpreters on the play store! It doesn't handle games with fancy text formatting, though - Beyond Zork and Bureaucracy are unplayable at the moment... Please fix! Also, running TerpEtude shows that colored text isn't implemented... I can play most games, though, so I like it!

title: Really diggin the app, more than jfrotz.
comment: Still some extra options would be nice, first of all the ability to change the background and font color. The white background hurts my eyes. :[

title: Great, i.f. on the go
comment: Love the TADS support especially, just wish multimedia TADS was supported hopefully on the to do list

title: The best IF interpreter for android
comment: The most versatile android interpreter for interactive fiction.   Now if only multimedia tads or z machine games could be the next step. No flaws yet.

title: The best yet
comment: I had some initial difficulties getting it to work, but the developer was very quick to help me resolve my issues. As yet this seems to be the best IF app on the Android market. It recognises blorb and TADS files, you can add your own downloads and, mist important for me, you can scroll through the text. The app combines all the best features of the others and goes one better to include TADS. At last I can play World's Apart.
